00035 template<typename _Tp>
00036 class octree_node_t{
00037   typedef _Tp                                   value_type;
00038 
00039 public:
00040 
00041   octree_node_t()
00042   {
00043     parent = 0;
00044     half_width = 0;
00045     std::memset(children, 0, 8 * sizeof(octree_node_t*));
00046     std::fill(centroid, centroid + 3, 0);
00047   }
00048 
00052   octree_node_t(octree_node_t& src)
00053   {
00054     if(this == &src) return;
00055 
00056     parent = src.parent;
00057     half_width = src.half_width;
00058     std::copy(src.children, src.children + 8, children);
00059     std::copy(src.centroid, src.centroid + 3, centroid);
00060     data = src.data; 
00061   }
00062 
00063   octree_node_t* parent;
00064   octree_node_t* children[8];
00065   my_float_t centroid[3];
00066   my_float_t half_width;  
00067 
00068   std::vector<_Tp> data;   
00069 };
00070 
00072 
00075 class PointOctree{
00076 
00077 public:
00078 
00079   typedef enum{
00080     NO_INTERSECTION = 0,
00081     CENTER_IN_CUBE,
00082     POSSIBLE_INTERSECTION,
00083     CUBE_AND_SPHERE_INTERSECT
00084   }cube_sphere_intersect_t;
00085 
00086   PointOctree(atom_vci first, atom_vci last,
00087               const my_float_t min_half_width = 4.5, const uint max_numel = 1)
00088   {
00089     A_min_half_width = min_half_width;
00090     A_max_numel = max_numel;
00091     build(first, last);
00092   }
00093 
00094   ~PointOctree()
00095   {
00096     free_octree_node(&A_root);
00097   }
00098 
00099   void
00100   get_close_points(atom_vci a, const my_float_t max_dist, 
00101                    std::vector<atom_vci> *close_points)
00102   { 
00103     get_close_points(&A_root, a->pos, max_dist, close_points, 0);
00104   }
00105 
00106   void 
00107   get_close_points(const octree_node_t<atom_vci> *cnode, const my_float_t *pt,
00108                    const my_float_t pt_tol, 
00109                    std::vector<atom_vci> *close_points, int level)
00110   {
00111     if(cnode->data.size()){
00112       // Allow push_back to choose when to grow the vector and see how it goes
00113       //close_points->reserve(cnode->data.size() + close_points->size());
00114       std::vector<atom_vci>::const_iterator data_iter = cnode->data.begin();
00115       for( ; data_iter < cnode->data.end(); ++data_iter)
00116         close_points->push_back(*data_iter);
00117       return;
00118     }
00119 
00120     for(int i = 0; i < 8; ++i){
00121       if(cnode->children[i] == 0) continue;
00122 
00123       cube_sphere_intersect_t rv;
00124       rv = point_in_cube(cnode->children[i]->centroid, 
00125                          cnode->children[i]->half_width, pt, pt_tol);
00126       if(rv == CENTER_IN_CUBE ||
00127          (rv == POSSIBLE_INTERSECTION &&
00128           cube_and_sphere_intersect(cnode->children[i]->centroid,
00129                                     cnode->children[i]->half_width, 
00130                                     pt, pt_tol))){ 
00131         get_close_points(cnode->children[i], pt, pt_tol, close_points,
00132                          level + 1); 
00133       }
00134     }
00135   }
00136 
00137   void
00138   bin_trace()
00139   {
00140     print_bin_trace(&A_root, 0);
00141   }
00142 
00143 private:
00144 
00145   void
00146   build(atom_vci first, atom_vci last)
00147   {
00148     // concept requirements
00149     __glibcxx_requires_valid_range(first, last);
00150 
00151     // Spin through the positions to find the min and max values
00152     my_float_t max_pt[3], min_pt[3];
00153     std::copy(first->pos, first->pos + 3, max_pt);
00154     std::copy(first->pos, first->pos + 3, min_pt);
00155     for(atom_vci p = first; p < last; ++p){
00156       for(uint i = 0; i < 3; ++i){
00157         if(max_pt[i] < p->pos[i]) max_pt[i] = p->pos[i];
00158         if(min_pt[i] > p->pos[i]) min_pt[i] = p->pos[i];
00159       }
00160     }
00161 
00162     // 
00163     // Use a square at the cost of more storage (larger tree) and possibly
00164     // a longer search time.  We do want a reasonable tolerance on the added
00165     // to each side so that points do not easily move outside
00166     //
00167 
00168     // Compute the centroid and add the tolerance to each coordinate of min 
00169     // and max to obtain the root side len.
00170     my_float_t max_side_len = 0;
00171     for(uint i = 0; i < 3; ++i){
00172       max_pt[i] += A_min_half_width;
00173       min_pt[i] -= A_min_half_width; 
00174       my_float_t len = max_pt[i] - min_pt[i];
00175       if(len > max_side_len) max_side_len = len;
00176     }
00177 
00178     //  
00179     // Should be an input variable at some point in time -- a Lys or Arg
00180     // sidechain can easily move more than 10.0 (A)
00181     //
00182     max_side_len += 40.0;
00183 
00184     // Tune size to be divisible by min half width otherwise we get 
00185     // a less tight set of boxes -- need to test on a number of different
00186     // point sets in order to get an idea of its impact
00187     my_float_t root_side_len = A_min_half_width;
00188     for( ; max_side_len > A_min_half_width; 
00189         max_side_len *= 0.5, root_side_len *= 2);
00190 
00191     for(uint i = 0; i < 3; ++i)
00192       A_root.centroid[i] = 0.5 * (max_pt[i] + min_pt[i]);
00193     A_root.half_width = 0.5 * root_side_len;
00194 
00195     // Copy data to root node
00196     A_root.data.reserve(last - first);
00197     for(atom_vci p = first; p < last; ++p) A_root.data.push_back(p);
00198     
00199     subdivide(&A_root);
00200   }
00201 
00202   void
00203   subdivide(octree_node_t<atom_vci>* cnode)
00204   {
00205     my_float_t h_width = 0.5 * cnode->half_width;
00206     if(cnode->data.size() <= A_max_numel || h_width < A_min_half_width) return;
00207 
00208     const my_float_t *centroid = cnode->centroid;
00209     std::vector<int> octant_count(8);
00210     std::fill(octant_count.begin(), octant_count.end(), 0);
00211     std::vector<int> partition(cnode->data.size());
00212 
00213     // Partition based on the position of each point
00214     std::vector<int>::iterator octant = partition.begin();
00215     std::vector<atom_vci>::const_iterator data_iter = cnode->data.begin();
00216     for( ; data_iter < cnode->data.end(); ++data_iter, ++octant){
00217       int idx = 0;
00218       //std::cout << **data_iter << "\n";
00219       for(int i = 2; i > -1; --i){
00220         idx <<= 1;
00221         if((*data_iter)->pos[i] >= centroid[i]) ++idx;
00222       }
00223       *octant = idx;
00224       ++octant_count[idx];
00225     }
00226 
00227     // Allocate the children for the octants with data and the childrens' 
00228     // data vectors
00229     for(int idx = 0; idx < 8; ++idx){
00230       if(octant_count[idx] == 0) continue;
00231 
00232       octree_node_t<atom_vci> *child = new octree_node_t<atom_vci>;
00233       child->parent = cnode;
00234       child->half_width = h_width;
00235       int dim_mask = 1;
00236       for(int j = 0; j < 3; ++j, dim_mask <<= 1){
00237         if(idx & dim_mask) child->centroid[j] = centroid[j] + h_width;
00238         else child->centroid[j] = centroid[j] - h_width;
00239       }
00240       child->data.reserve(octant_count[idx]);
00241       cnode->children[idx] = child;
00242     }
00243 
00244     // Partition the data based on the partition array
00245     octant = partition.begin();
00246     data_iter = cnode->data.begin();
00247     for( ; data_iter < cnode->data.end(); ++data_iter, ++octant){
00248        octree_node_t<atom_vci> *child = *(cnode->children + *octant);
00249        child->data.push_back(*data_iter);
00250     }
00251     cnode->data.clear();
00252 
00253     // Subdivide children
00254     for(int j = 0; j < 8; ++j)
00255       if(octant_count[j]) subdivide(cnode->children[j]);
00256 #if 0
00257 
00258     // partition based on the position of each point 
00259     const my_float_t* centroid = cnode->centroid;
00260 
00261     std::vector<_Tp>& data = cnode->data;
00262     for(size_t pt_idx = 0; pt_idx < data.size(); ++pt_idx){
00263       const _Tp& pt = data[pt_idx];
00264    
00265       std::vector<bool> above(3, false), below(3, false);
00266       for(uint i = 0; i < 3; ++i){
00267         if((pt->pos[i] - A_min_half_width) <= centroid[i]) below[i] = true;
00268         if((pt->pos[i] + A_min_half_width) >= centroid[i]) above[i] = true;
00269       }
00270 
00271       // Explicitly write out the 8 cases -- likely to be easier to read
00272       std::vector<bool> pt_in_bins(8, false);
00273       pt_in_bins[0] = (below[0] && below[1] && below[2]);
00274       pt_in_bins[1] = (above[0] && below[1] && below[2]);
00275       pt_in_bins[2] = (below[0] && above[1] && below[2]);
00276       pt_in_bins[3] = (above[0] && above[1] && below[2]);
00277       pt_in_bins[4] = (below[0] && below[1] && above[2]);
00278       pt_in_bins[5] = (above[0] && below[1] && above[2]);
00279       pt_in_bins[6] = (below[0] && above[1] && above[2]);
00280       pt_in_bins[7] = (above[0] && above[1] && above[2]);
00281        
00282       for(uint i = 0; i < 8; ++i){
00283         if(!pt_in_bins[i]) continue;
00284 
00285         octree_node_t<_Tp>* child = cnode->children[i];
00286         if(!child){
00287           cnode->children[i] = new octree_node_t<_Tp>;
00288           child = cnode->children[i];
00289           child->parent = cnode;
00290           child->half_width = h_width;
00291           uint dim_mask = 1; 
00292           for(uint j = 0; j < 3; ++j, dim_mask <<= 1)
00293             if(i & dim_mask) child->centroid[j] = centroid[j] + h_width;
00294             else child->centroid[j] = centroid[j] - h_width;
00295         }
00296         child->data.push_back(pt);
00297       }
00298     }
00299 
00300     // Recursively subdivide children
00301     for(uint i = 0; i < 8; ++i)
00302       if(cnode->children[i]){
00303         subdivide_with_overlap(cnode->children[i]);
00304         cnode->data.clear();
00305       }
00306 #endif
00307   }
00308 
00309 #if 0
00310   const std::vector<_Tp>*
00311   near_by_points(const my_float_t* pos, const my_float_t max_dist)
00312   {
00313     const octree_node_t<_Tp>* cnode = &A_root;
00314     my_float_t h_width;
00315     const my_float_t h_max_dist = 0.5 * max_dist;
00316     for(h_width = A_root.half_width; h_width > h_max_dist; h_width *= 0.5){
00317       uint cube_idx = 0;
00318       if(pos[0] > cnode->centroid[0]) cube_idx += 1;
00319       if(pos[1] > cnode->centroid[1]) cube_idx += 2;
00320       if(pos[2] > cnode->centroid[2]) cube_idx += 4;
00321 
00322       if(cnode->children[cube_idx] == 0) break;
00323       cnode = cnode->children[cube_idx];
00324     }
00325    
00326     return &(cnode->data);
00327   }
00328 #endif

00345 
00346   void
00347   free_octree_node(octree_node_t<atom_vci>* cnode)
00348   {
00349     bool leaf_node = false;
00350     if(cnode->data.size()){
00351       cnode->data.clear();
00352       leaf_node = true;
00353     }
00354     if(leaf_node) return;
00355 
00356     for(int i = 0; i < 8; ++i)
00357       if(cnode->children[i]){
00358         free_octree_node(cnode->children[i]);
00359         delete cnode->children[i];
00360         cnode->children[i] = 0;
00361       }
00362   }
00363 
00364 #if 0
00365   // Needs more testing
00366   void
00367   bin_positions(octree_node_t<_Tp> &cnode, const my_float_t max_dist,
00368                 const std::vector<const my_float_t*> &pos_vec,
00369                 std::vector<bin_type> *bins)
00370   {
00371     // If data is stored in the current it node, the assumption is the current
00372     // node is a leaf node.
00373     if(cnode.data.size()){
00374       bin_type bin;
00375       bin.bin_data = &(cnode.data);
00376       bin.positions.resize(pos_vec.size()); 
00377       std::vector<const my_float_t*>::const_iterator p_iter;
00378       std::vector<const my_float_t*>::iterator dest = bin.positions.begin();
00379       for(p_iter = pos_vec.begin(); p_iter < pos_vec.end(); ++p_iter, ++dest)
00380         *dest = *p_iter;
00381       bins->push_back(bin);
00382       return;
00383     }
00384     if(cnode.half_width <= max_dist){
00385       std::cerr << "Unhandled condition in bin_positions!" << std::endl;
00386       return;
00387     }
00388 
00389     std::vector< std::vector<const my_float_t*> > children_vectors(8);
00390     std::vector<const my_float_t*>::const_iterator pos_iter;
00391     for(pos_iter = pos_vec.begin(); pos_iter < pos_vec.end(); ++pos_iter){
00392       const my_float_t *pos = *pos_iter;
00393       size_t cube_idx = 0;
00394       if(*pos > cnode.centroid[0]) cube_idx += 1;
00395       ++pos;
00396       if(*pos > cnode.centroid[1]) cube_idx += 2;
00397       ++pos;
00398       if(*pos > cnode.centroid[2]) cube_idx += 4;
00399 
00400       if(*(cnode.children + cube_idx)) 
00401         (children_vectors.begin() + cube_idx)->push_back(*pos_iter);
00402     }
00403 
00404     octree_node_t<_Tp> **child_p = cnode.children;
00405     for(size_t i = 0; i < 8; ++i, ++child_p)
00406       if(*child_p) 
00407         bin_positions(**child_p, max_dist, children_vectors[i], bins);
00408   }

00410 /*
00411   bool 
00412   point_in_node(const my_float_t *pt, const octree_node_t &cnode, 
00413                 const my_float_t pt_tol)
00414   {
00415     my_float_t dist[3];
00416     for(size_t i = 0; i < 3; ++i){
00417       dist[i] = cnode.centroid[i] - pt[i];     
00418       dist[i] = (dist[i] < 0 ? -1.0 * dist[i] : dist[i]);
00419     }
00420  
00421     // If pt in box, return true
00422     if(dist[0] <= cnode.half_width && dist[1] <= cnode.half_width &&
00423        dist[2] <= cnode.half_width) return true;
00424 
00425     // If pt not in box + tol, return false
00426     if(dist[0] <= cnode.half_width + pt_tol && 
00427        dist[1] <= cnode.half_width + pt_tol &&
00428        dist[2] <= cnode.half_width + pt_tol) return false;
00429  
00430     // Project centroid to sphere with center at pt and radius pt_tol
00431     sphere S(pt, pt_tol);
00432     my_float_t pt_on_sphere[3];
00433     S.proj2surf(cnode.centroid, pt_on_sphere);
00434 
00435     // If projected centroid is in the box, return true
00436     // else return false 
00437     if(dist_squared(pt_on_sphere, pt) >= pt_tol * pt_tol) return false;
00438     return true; 
00439   }
00440 */                
00441 #endif
00442 
00443   inline cube_sphere_intersect_t
00444   point_in_cube(const my_float_t *centroid, const my_float_t half_width, 
00445                 const my_float_t *pt, const my_float_t radius)
00446   {
00447     my_float_t dist[3];
00448     for(int i = 0; i < 3; ++i){
00449       dist[i] = centroid[i] - pt[i];
00450       dist[i] = (dist[i] < 0 ? -1.0 * dist[i] : dist[i]);
00451     }
00452   
00453     // If center in box, return true 
00454     if(dist[0] <= half_width && dist[1] <= half_width && dist[2] <= half_width)
00455       return CENTER_IN_CUBE;
00456 
00457     if(dist[0] <= half_width + radius && dist[1] <= half_width + radius &&
00458        dist[2] <= half_width + radius) return POSSIBLE_INTERSECTION;
00459 
00460     // If center not in box + tol, return false
00461     return NO_INTERSECTION;
00462   }
00463 
00464   cube_sphere_intersect_t 
00465   cube_and_sphere_intersect(const my_float_t *centroid, 
00466                             const my_float_t half_width,
00467                             const my_float_t *center, const my_float_t radius)
00468   {
00469   
00470     my_float_t sign[3];
00471     sign[0] = sign[1] = sign[2] = 0;
00472 
00473 #ifdef TRACE
00474     std::cout << "\nCentroid: " << centroid[0] << " " << centroid[1] << " "
00475               << centroid[2] << "\n";
00476     std::cout << "half_width: " << half_width << "\n";
00477     std::cout << "center: " << center[0] << " " << center[1] << " "
00478               << center[2] << "\n";
00479     std::cout << "radius: " << radius << "\n";
00480 #endif
00481 
00482     for(int i = 0; i < 3; ++i){
00483       my_float_t tmp = centroid[i] - half_width;
00484       if(tmp - radius <= center[i] && center[i] <= tmp) sign[i] = -1;
00485   
00486       tmp = centroid[i] + half_width;
00487       if(tmp <= center[i] && center[i] <= tmp + radius) sign[i] = 1;
00488     }
00489 #ifdef TRACE
00490     std::cout << "Sign: " << sign[0] << " " << sign[1] << " " 
00491               << sign[2] << "\n";
00492 #endif
00493 
00494     /* Center is in the rectangular solid defined by a face and ?? and is 
00495      * closer than radius to that face? */
00496     if((sign[0] && !sign[1] && !sign[2]) || (!sign[0] && sign[1] && !sign[2]) ||
00497        (!sign[0] && !sign[1] && sign[2])){
00498 #ifdef TRACE
00499       std::cout << "Center of sphere is adjacent to a face\n";
00500 #endif
00501       return CUBE_AND_SPHERE_INTERSECT;
00502     }
00503 
00504     /* Sphere contains a cube corner? */
00505     my_float_t dist[3];
00506     if(sign[0] && sign[1] && sign[2]){
00507       for(int i = 0; i < 3; ++i)
00508         dist[i] = centroid[i] + sign[i] * half_width - center[i];
00509 #ifdef TRACE
00510       std::cout << "dist[]: " << dist[0] << " " << dist[1] << " "
00511                 << dist[2] << "\n";
00512 #endif
00513       if(radius*radius >= dist[0]*dist[0] + dist[1]*dist[1] + dist[2]*dist[2]){
00514 #ifdef TRACE
00515         std::cout << "Sphere contains a cube corner\n";
00516 #endif
00517         return CUBE_AND_SPHERE_INTERSECT;
00518       }else{
00519 #ifdef TRACE
00520         std::cout << "Sphere does not contain a cube corner\n";
00521 #endif
00522         return NO_INTERSECTION;
00523       }
00524     }
00525 
00526     if(!sign[0]){
00527       if(line_in_sphere(centroid, half_width, center, radius, 0, sign))
00528         return CUBE_AND_SPHERE_INTERSECT;
00529     }else if(!sign[1]){
00530       if(line_in_sphere(centroid, half_width, center, radius, 1, sign))
00531         return CUBE_AND_SPHERE_INTERSECT;
00532     }else if(!sign[2]){
00533       if(line_in_sphere(centroid, half_width, center, radius, 2, sign))
00534         return CUBE_AND_SPHERE_INTERSECT;
00535     }
00536   
00537 #ifdef TRACE
00538     std::cout << "No intersection!\n";
00539 #endif
00540     return NO_INTERSECTION;
00541   }
00542 
00543   void
00544   print_bin_trace(const octree_node_t<atom_vci> *cnode, int level)
00545   {
00546     if(cnode->data.size()){
00547       std::cout << "\nBin at level " << level << "\n";
00548       std::cout << "\nCentroid: " << cnode->centroid[0] << " " 
00549                 << cnode->centroid[1] << " " << cnode->centroid[2] << "\n";
00550       std::cout << "\nHalf Width: " <<  cnode->half_width << "\n";
00551       std::cout << "\nPositions:\n";
00552   
00553       for(int i = 0; i < cnode->data.size(); ++i)
00554         std::cout << "\t " << cnode->data[i]->pos[0] << " "
00555                   << cnode->data[i]->pos[1] << " " 
00556                   << cnode->data[i]->pos[2] << "\n";
00557       return;
00558     }
00559   
00560     for(int i = 0; i < 8; ++i)
00561       if(cnode->children[i]) print_bin_trace(cnode->children[i], level + 1);
00562   }
00563 
00564   bool
00565   line_in_sphere(const my_float_t *centroid, const my_float_t half_width,
00566                  const my_float_t *center, const my_float_t radius, 
00567                  const int idx, const my_float_t *sign)
00568   {
00569     my_float_t pt[3];
00570     my_float_t RHS = radius*radius;
00571     my_float_t S1, S2;
00572   
00573     for(int i = 0; i < 3; ++i)
00574       if(i != idx){
00575         pt[i] = centroid[i] + sign[i]*half_width;
00576         RHS -= (pt[i] - center[i]) * (pt[i] - center[i]);
00577       }
00578 #ifdef TRACE
00579     std::cout << "pt: " << pt[0] << " " << pt[1] << " " << pt[2] << "\n";
00580 #endif
00581   
00582     if(RHS < 0) return false;
00583     RHS = std::sqrt(RHS);
00584 #ifdef TRACE
00585     std::cout << "RHS: " << RHS << "\n";
00586 #endif
00587   
00588     S1 = center[idx] - RHS;
00589     S2 = center[idx] + RHS;
00590     if((S1 < centroid[idx] - half_width && S2 < centroid[idx] - half_width) ||
00591        (S1 > centroid[idx] + half_width && S2 > centroid[idx] + half_width))
00592       return false;
00593     return true;
00594   }
00595  
00596   octree_node_t<atom_vci> A_root;  
00597   uint A_max_numel; 
00598   my_float_t A_min_half_width;   
00599 
00600   static const std::string A_fname;  
00601 };
00602 
00603 } // end namesapce SimSite3D
00604 #endif
